## AUDIT-10 vs HAS

In psychology, comparing different questionnaire instruments like AUDIT-10 vs HAS is often a crucial but time-consuming task. AUDIT-10 (Alcohol use disorders identification test) , a standard tool for detecting alcohol consumption patterns, differs significantly from HAS, which gauges a broad spectrum of mental health conditionsâ€”from living conditions to medical history. Achieving a meaningful comparison between these instruments normally entails manually harmonising each item, a process that can be laborious and fraught with subjective interpretation.


## Compare the items in AUDIT-10 and HAS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In0sIHsicXVlc3Rpb25fdGV4dCI6ICJIb3cgb2Z0ZW4gZG8geW91IGhhdmUgc2l4IG9yIG1vcmUgdW5pdHMgb2YgYWxjb2hvbCBvbiBvbmUgb2NjYXNpb24__" target="harmonyapp">Import AUDIT-10 and HAS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform

That's where Harmony steps in. Equipped with powerful natural language processing and generative AI models, Harmony makes the harmonisation of AUDIT-10 vs HAS a breeze. With Harmony, psychologists and social scientists can quickly determine the percentage match of each item between AUDIT-10 and HAS in multiple languages. This further allows for comparisons both within and across multiple studies, facilitating a more comprehensive analysis of cohort and [longitudinal data](/item-harmonisation/harmony-a-free-ai-tool-for-longitudinal-study/).
